etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Alexander Somerville (1811–1885), journalist and soldier. From chomp + -er

definitions: A person who, or an animal or thing which, bites, chews, crushes, or eats something, especially vigorously or greedily.

notes.text: Frequently with distinguishing word specifying the thing chewed, eaten, etc.

definitions: In plural: a set of teeth, or false teeth. Occasionally in singular: a tooth.
